name: Curiosity (Free Spoken Word #3)
description:
Derived from the word of the day I picked from TREASVRE TROVE

Where am I? Who is this person holding me? Why are they about to cut this cord attached to my body?

Why is the sky so different? Sometimes it’s dark and I can’t see at all, and sometimes the blue makes me smile. And other times water falls from above and I get all wet and cold. One time I saw flashes of light and loud noises and was so scared.

Why is this girl making fun of me and trying to throw dirt at me while giggling with a beautiful smile on her face.

She just turned back at me in class and smiled, what does that mean? What should I do?

Why am I learning these traditionalist values that have no use-case in our modern world?

Why do I have to answer questions that I don’t even really know on these questionnaires?

Sexuality? How do I even figure that one out if I can’t openly discuss my thoughts comfortably.

What really is a marriage? A traditionalist idea that’s boxed us into a certain way of thinking for far too long? And why does it have to be so important.

Is that really what I have to do? Find someone to live a life of complacency with?

How do I end this feeling of hatred for denying myself the comfort of exploring my curiosities?

Maybe it’s mental, I just need to find a way to unblock the guilts and denials in my psyche.

Unlocking a box full of patterns taken that went against your honest thoughts is quite the task.

I feel the risk is worth taking, finally.
